dialogue_metadata.inferred_vibe: Informational and conversational, discussing recent financial news.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The world's billionaires are now worth a collective 7.9 trillion dollars, down 650 billion from last year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The world's billionaires are now worth a collective seven point nine trillion dollars, down six hundred fifty billion from last year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In raw terms, the worlds billionaires are worth $8 trillion, down $700 billion from 2019.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and that's as of March 20th, right? When they finalized the list.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and that's as of March twentieth, right? When they finalized the list.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Forbes Worlds Billionaires list is a snapshot of wealth using stock prices and exchange rates from March 18, 2020.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And get this—Jeff Bezos is still number one, even after giving away 34 billion in Amazon stock to his ex-wife.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And get this-Jeff Bezos is still number one, even after giving away thirty four billion in Amazon stock to his ex-wife.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Jeff Bezos is the worlds wealthiest person for the third year in a row, despite giving $36 billion worth of his Amazon stock to his ex-wife MacKenzie Bezos as part of their divorce settlement last summer.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, that divorce settlement didn't even knock him out of the top spot. His net worth is still, what, 112 billion?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, that divorce settlement didn't even knock him out of the top spot. His net worth is still, what, one hundred twelve billion?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hes worth $113 billion, buoyed by a 15% rise in Amazons shares since our 2019 list.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh, thanks to Amazon's stock rising 14% since last year. And they're hiring like crazy now—95,000 new workers to handle all the online shopping.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh, thanks to Amazon's stock rising fourteen percent since last year. And they're hiring like crazy now-ninety five thousand new workers to handle all the online shopping.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hes worth $113 billion, buoyed by a 15% rise in Amazons shares since our 2019 list. The e-commerce giant he runs has been in the spotlight amid the pandemic; its hiring 100,000 full- and part-time workers to help meet increased demand from consumers staying home and shopping online.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild how the pandemic is really reshaping these fortunes. I mean, some are tanking, but others, like Zoom's Eric Yuan, are booming.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild how the pandemic is really reshaping these fortunes. I mean, some are tanking, but others, like Zoom's Eric Yuan, are booming.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Still, Forbes found 178 newcomers hailing from 20 countries, including some, like Zoom Video Communications founder and CEO Eric Yuan, whose service is booming amid our current shelter-in-place reality.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? He's one of the 175 newcomers on the list this year. And then there's Qin Yinglin, the pig breeder—his wealth jumped over 14 billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? He's one of the one hundred seventy five newcomers on the list this year. And then there's Qin Yinglin, the pig breeder-his wealth jumped over fourteen billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Still, Forbes found 178 newcomers hailing from 20 countries, including some, like Zoom Video Communications founder and CEO Eric Yuan, whose service is booming amid our current shelter-in-place reality.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, African swine flu drove up prices, and shares nearly tripled. He's worth 18.4 billion now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, African swine flu drove up prices, and shares nearly tripled. He's worth eighteen point four billion now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hes ranked No. 43 and is worth $18.5 billion--a $14.2 billion jump since the 2019 list, after shares of his Shenzhen-listed Muyuan Foods nearly tripled as the African swine flu reduced the supply of pigs and drove up prices.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, WeWork's Adam Neumann fell off the list entirely. Talk about a reversal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, WeWork's Adam Neumann fell off the list entirely. Talk about a reversal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Altogether, 267 people who made last years list have dropped off as businesses faltered; among the most notable drop-offs is Adam Neumann of WeWork.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And 240 women made the cut this time, with Alice Walton as the richest woman at 54.2 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And two hundred forty women made the cut this time, with Alice Walton as the richest woman at fifty four point two billion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alice Walton, an heir to the Walmart fortune, is the richest woman, ranked No.9 at $54.4 billion. Altogether 241 women made the list, including 7 who share a fortune with a spouse, sibling or child.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting how the list is such a snapshot in time, you know? Stock prices from one day can change everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting how the list is such a snapshot in time, you know? Stock prices from one day can change everything.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Forbes Worlds Billionaires list is a snapshot of wealth using stock prices and exchange rates from March 18, 2020.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. They even mention that some people get richer or poorer within days of publication. It's so volatile.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. They even mention that some people get richer or poorer within days of publication. It's so volatile.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Some people become richer or poorer within days of publication.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Still, the U.S. has the most billionaires—612—followed by greater China with 455.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, the U.S. has the most billionairesminus six hundred twelve-followed by greater China with four hundred fifty five.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. remains the country with the most billionaires, with 614, followed by greater China (including Hong Kong and Macao), with 456.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Makes you wonder how this all shakes out by next year's list, with everything going on.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Makes you wonder how this all shakes out by next year's list, with everything going on.
